summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Judge Alison J. Nathan, outlining the government's plan to obtain and review investigative files from the prior Florida investigation into Jeffrey Epstein for potential disclosure in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. It details the sources of files, the legal framework for disclosure obligations, and the steps being taken to review materials from various Florida agencies. This is a government filing from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, addressed to Judge Alison J. Nathan, dated October 7, 2020. It details the prosecution's planned approach to reviewing materials from prior, separate investigations (specifically the USAO-SDFL's Florida investigation and USAO-SDGA's CVRA civil litigation) for potential Giglio or 3500 material relevant to the Ghislaine Maxwell prosecution, while arguing those prior offices are not part of the current prosecution team.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell; recipient of this letter outlining the government's discovery review plan.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Ghislaine Maxwell is the defendant in the prosecution that is the subject of this document. The government mentions gathering information regarding her from prior civil litigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the prior Florida investigation (2005-2010) for sexual abuse of minors; his prior case is the source of files being reviewed for the Maxwell prosecution.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: An employee of Jeffrey Epstein who was prosecuted for obstruction of justice in a separate case (10 Cr. 80015 (KAM)); some files from that case have been received.

persons.name: Attorney-1
persons.context: Attorney-1 was the primary line assistant on the prior USAO-SDFL investigation into Epstein. The government intends to review this attorney's preserved emails for potential witness communications relevant to the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Audrey Strauss, as the Acting U.S. Attorney, is the signatory of this government filing submitted to the court.

connections.description: Maxwell is being prosecuted for crimes related to Epstein's sexual abuse of minors, indicating an alleged conspiratorial relationship.
Rodriguez is identified as an employee of Epstein who was later prosecuted for obstruction of justice related to Epstein's case.
Judge Nathan is the presiding judicial officer over Maxwell's criminal case.

Attorney-1 was the primary line assistant on the prior USAO-SDFL investigation into Epstein, which would have involved conduct related to Maxwell. The current prosecution is reviewing Attorney-1's emails for material on Maxwell.
Audrey Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is submitting this filing to the Honorable Alison J. Nathan, the presiding judge in the case.

events.title: Initial Conference in Maxwell Case
events.description: Court asked the Government about its plan to ensure timely review of files from other agencies for potential disclosures in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Start of Florida Investigation into Epstein
events.description: The Palm Beach Police Department opened its investigation into Jeffrey Epstein for sexual abuse of minors.

events.title: Federal Florida Investigation
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida and the FBI's Palm Beach office conducted a federal investigation and prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: SDNY Investigation Opened
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, the FBI New York Office, and the NYPD opened an investigation into matters related to Jeffrey Epstein, leading to the charges against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Electronic Discovery Deadline
events.description: The Government expects to meet this deadline for the completion of electronic discovery productions in the Maxwell case.

events.title: USAO-SDGA Designated for CVRA Litigation
events.description: Beginning in or about 2019, attorneys with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Georgia were designated to represent the U.S. in CVRA civil litigation brought by Epstein victims against the USAO-SDFL.

events.title: Government Filing on Disclosure Obligations
events.description: The government files this document with the court, outlining its extensive plans to review materials from prior investigations for potential disclosure in the Ghislaine Maxwell prosecution.

keyFacts: The Government has produced approximately 328,863 pages of discovery to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense as of October 7, 2020.
The Prosecution Team (SDNY USAO, FBI NY, NYPD) had no involvement in the prior Florida Investigation (2005-2010) into Epstein, which creates a legal boundary for disclosure obligations.

The Government is voluntarily reviewing files from six sources related to the Florida Investigation, including the Palm Beach Police, Palm Beach State's Attorney, FBI Florida, USAO-SDFL, and DOJ OPR emails.

The Department of Justice's Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) conducted an unrelated investigation into the resolution of the Florida Epstein case and gathered emails from involved attorneys.
The Government states it is not aware of any exculpatory (Brady) material contained in any witness statements from the Florida investigation but will continue to review.

The government argues that the prior offices (USAO-SDFL, USAO-SDGA) are not part of the current Maxwell prosecution team, as they did not participate in witness interviews, strategy, charging decisions, or grand jury presentations for this case.

Despite no legal obligation, the government plans to electronically search the preserved emails of 'Attorney-1', the primary line assistant on the prior Florida investigation, for terms related to the defendant, victims, and witnesses in the Maxwell case.

The government's review focuses on identifying non-duplicative Giglio or 3500 material for any overlapping victims or witnesses between the prior Florida investigation and the current Maxwell prosecution.

The government will contact the USAO-SDGA to ask if it gathered any information regarding Ghislaine Maxwell or had substantive communications with relevant witnesses during its representation in the CVRA civil litigation.
